Hello, I am learning JUnit the hard way, I have inherited some code to
whic=
h I need to add some new testCases. This is in RAD 6.x, which uses
JUnit 3.=
8. As far as I can tell, I cannot upgrade to JUnit 4.x becuz
RAD 6.x cannot=
 go beyond Java 1.4.2. Because I am learning, I am not
sure if my problem i=
s with the IDE or with JUnit code - here's the
description:

The original p=
rogrammer had a System.getProperty("TestPath") in his
TestAll class which e=
xtends TestCase and collects all the tests in the
TestPath directory into a=
 TestSuite and runs them etc...

This runs but does not find the test class=
es, probably becuz
getTestPath() returns null : )
I cannot find where TestP=
ath is set, created, or otherwise acquired.

es are still not found. Is there a
standard for where to put and maintain t=
he property "TestPath" in
